com.qoppa.pdfText

Class PDFText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qoppa.pdfText.PDFText

  • public class PDFText
extends java.lang.Object
    PDFText is the class to extract the list of words contained in a PDF document as a Vector. It also returns the DocumentInfo for the document as well as the page count.
    Author:
    Qoppa Software

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PDFText.KeyInfoText
      This is the Main-Class for the jPDFText.jar that can generate server key requests, validate a key, and display server information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PDFText

        public PDFText(java.io.InputStream inStream,
       IPassword password)
        throws PDFException
        Creates a PDFText object from a PDF InputStream.
        Parameters:
        inStream - InputStream to read the pdf document from.
        password - An object that provides passwords to open the document, leave null if not needed. When working with documents that have no passwords, the host application should pass null for the value of this parameter. When documents are known to have passwords, the host application should pass an instance of the PDFPassword class that can hold a single password or a list of passwords.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • PDFText

        public PDFText(java.lang.String fileName,
       IPassword password)
        throws PDFException
        Loads a PDFText object from a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the PDF file.
        password - An object that provides passwords to open the document, leave null if not needed. When working with documents that have no passwords, the host application should pass null for the value of this parameter. When documents are known to have passwords, the host application should pass an instance of the PDFPassword class that can hold a single password or a list of passwords.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • PDFText

        public PDFText(java.net.URL url,
       IPassword password)
        throws PDFException
        Loads a PDFText object from a URL.
        Parameters:
        url - URL pointint to the location of the PDF file.
        password - An object that provides passwords to open the document, leave null if not needed. When working with documents that have no passwords, the host application should pass null for the value of this parameter. When documents are known to have passwords, the host application should pass an instance of the PDFPassword class that can hold a single password or a list of passwords.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getDocumentInfo

        public DocumentInfo getDocumentInfo()

      • getDocumentInfo

        public static DocumentInfo getDocumentInfo(java.io.InputStream inStream,
                           IPassword password)
                                    throws PDFException
        Returns a DocumentInfo object containing the information section of a PDF document (author, title, etc.)
        Parameters:
        inStream - InputStream to read the pdf document from.
        password - An object that provides passwords to open the document, leave null if not needed. When working with documents that have no passwords, the host application should pass null for the value of this parameter. When documents are known to have passwords, the host application should pass an instance of the PDFPassword class that can hold a single password or a list of passwords.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns the name of the pdf document.

      • getPageCount

        public int getPageCount()
        Returns the number of pages of the pdf document.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
                         throws PDFException
        Returns the text in the pdf document as a String. Pages are separated with a return char.
        Returns:
        Text contained in the pdf document as String.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText(int pageIndex)
                         throws PDFException
        Returns text contained in the specified page of the pdf document as a String.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        Returns:
        Text contained in the specified page as a String.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getTextInArea

        public java.lang.String getTextInArea(int pageIndex,
                             java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D textArea)
                               throws PDFException
        Returns text contained in an area of a page
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        textArea - the area of the page to get text from.
        Returns:
        A String containing the text in the area. If there is no text, this method will return null.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getTextWithCursors

        public java.lang.String getTextWithCursors(int pageIndex,
                                  java.awt.geom.Point2D startCursor,
                                  java.awt.geom.Point2D endCursor)
                                    throws PDFException
        Returns the text contained between the start and end cursors, in "reading mode". Reading mode implies line wrapping, column detection and wrapping and more. The effect should be the same as if the user chose the text selection tool, pressed down at the startCursor location and dragged to the endCursor location.
        Parameters:
        startCursor - the location where the cursor should start selection
        endCursor - The location where the cursor ends selection
        Returns:
        A TextSelection object representing the text that was selected.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • setAppletKey

        public static boolean setAppletKey(java.lang.String key,
                   java.applet.Applet applet)
        Method to unlock the production version of the library.
        Parameters:
        key - Production key.

      • setKey

        public static boolean setKey(java.lang.String key)
        Method to unlock the production version of the library.
        Parameters:
        key - Production key.

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns version string for jPDFText. If this is the demo version, the return string will contain 'Demo Version' at the end.

      • getWords

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getWords()
                                            throws PDFException
        Returns all words in the pdf document as a Vector of Strings. The default separators used to separate words are the following: ,/;\n><():?&.@*\t To customize separators, see getWordsWithPositions(int, String)
        Returns:
        Words contained in the pdf document as a Vector of Strings.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getWords

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getWords(int pageIndex)
                                            throws PDFException
        Returns all words contained in the specified page of the pdf document as a Vector of Strings. The default separators used to separate words are the following: ,/;\n><():?&.@*\t To customize separators, see getWordsWithPositions(int, String)
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        Returns:
        Words contained in the specified page as a Vector of Strings.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getLinesWithPositions

        public java.util.Vector<TextPosition> getLinesWithPositions(int pageIndex)
                                                     throws PDFException
        Returns position information for all the lines of text in the specified page of the PDF document.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        Returns:
        A Vector of TextPosition objects.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getWordsWithPositions

        public java.util.Vector<TextPosition> getWordsWithPositions(int pageIndex)
                                                     throws PDFException
        Returns position information for all the words in the specified page of the PDF document. The default separators used to separate words are the following: ,/;\n><():?&.@*\t To customize separators, see getWordsWithPositions(int, String)
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        Returns:
        A Vector of TextPosition objects.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getWordsWithPositions

        public java.util.Vector<TextPosition> getWordsWithPositions(int pageIndex,
                                                   java.lang.String wordSeparators)
                                                     throws PDFException
        Returns position information for all the words in the specified page of the PDF document, given a set of word separators.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - is the 0 based page number. pageIndex = 0 is the first page of the document.
        wordSeparators - A list of single character word separators.
        Returns:
        A Vector of TextPosition objects.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • findText

        public java.util.Vector<TextPosition> findText(int pageIndex,
                                      java.lang.String searchText,
                                      boolean caseSensitive,
                                      boolean wholeWords)
                                        throws PDFException
        Searches a page for text and returns a list of TextPosition objects for each of the occurrences of the string in the page. If there are no occurrences, the method returns a Vector of length 0.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - The index of the page to search in
        searchText - The text to search for.
        caseSensitive - Flag indicating whether the search should be case sensitive.
        wholeWords - Flag indicating whether the search should only look at whole words.
        Returns:
        A list of TextPosition objects.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • usePermissionsPassword

        public boolean usePermissionsPassword(java.lang.String password)
                               throws PDFException
        Tells the PDFText object that the permissions password is known, so all permissions are granted.
        Parameters:
        password - The permissions password
        Returns:
        true if the password was validated or the document is not encrypted
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • close

        public void close()
        Close / release all resources held by this document. After this method is called, this object becomes invalid and should not be used anymore.
